sen.j: 高陽院（かやいん・賀陽院）は、平安京にあった里内裏の一つ。
sen.e: Kayain was one of the Satodairi (temporary imperial residence) in the Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 西洞院大路の西・大炊御門大路の北にあった南北2町（後4町）の大規模な邸宅であった。
sen.e: It was a huge residence located at the west of Nishinotoin Oji street and north of Oinomikado Oji street, which size was north to south 2 cho (1cho is approx. 109 meters) (later it was enlarged to 4 cho).
sen.cmt: （後4町）がどの様な意味か分かりません。左記の様にしています。

sen.cmt: スペース削除町の表記をメートル法に訂正。

sen.j: 元は桓武天皇の皇子・賀陽親王の邸宅であったとされ、その後所有者は転々としたが、11世紀初頭に摂政藤原頼通は、この地を大いに気に入って敷地を倍の4町に広げて豪華な寝殿造の建物を造営した。
sen.e: It is said that originally it was the residence of Imperial Prince Kaya of Emperor Kanmu, though the owner changed many times and finally in the early 11th century, Sessho (a regent) FUJIWARA no Yorimichi loved the place very much, owned, enlarged the premises to double in length to 4 cho and constructed a gorgeous Shinden-zukuri (architecture representative of a nobleman's residence in the Heian period) buildings.

sen.j: 頼通はここを拠点に長期政権を運営していた。
sen.e: Yorimichi managed a longtime rule of the government based in this Kayain..

sen.e: When he retired to Uji Byodo-in Temple, although the ownership was made transferred to the heads of the line of regents and advisers, the residence was provided as satodairi of the line of emperors

sen.j: 鳥羽天皇の妃であった藤原泰子（頼通の玄孫、父は関白藤原忠実）に高陽院の女院号が与えられたのも、ここに居住していた事に由来する。
sen.e: The reason why nyoingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) "Kayanoin" was bestowed to FUJIWARA no Taishi (Yasuko) (a great-great-granddaughter of Yorimichi and a daughter of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), FUJIWARA no Tadazane) is derived from the fact that she lived in this palace.

sen.j: 以後も火災のたびに再建され、後鳥羽上皇もここを御所として院政の拠点とした。
sen.e: Even after the fires caused many times, the residence was reconstructed and the retired Emperor Gotoba also based on this palace and administered Insei (Cloister government.)

sen.j: 承久の乱につながる鎌倉幕府打倒の謀議が行われたのも高陽院であった。
sen.e: The venue where conspiration to ruin the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) which led to the Jokyu War was taken place was also this Kayain.

sen.j: 乱直後の貞応2年（1223年）に放火にあって焼失したものの、幕府を憚って以後再建される事はなかった。
sen.e: After the war in 1223, Kayain was set a fire and lost, however, it was never rebuilt being afraid of the bakufu.
